pull.title: fuzz: Add PartiallyDownloadedBlock target
pull.body: This PR adds a fuzz target for `PartiallyDownloadedBlock`, which we currently do not have any coverage for.

Thanks for working on improved fuzz targets!

I've left some nano-nits that can be ignored. Please let us know if you want this merged or want to address the nits.

events.message: [block encodings] Make CheckBlock mockable for PartiallyDownloadedBlock
[block encodings] Avoid fuzz blocking asserts in PartiallyDownloadedBlock
[fuzz] Assert that omitting missing transactions always fails block reconstruction

events.body: @MarcoFalke addressed all your comments. CI failures seem unrelated (restarted the failing jobs).

lgtm. Follow-ups can be done in new pulls, if there are any.

comments.body: maybe add named arguments for the bools

maybe we could memorize if we decided to skip an unavailable tx (i.e. one we were supposed to include in `missing`), and later assert that the FillBlock result must not be `READ_STATUS_OK` in this case?
Good idea, added an extra commit for this

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,126 @@
+#include <blockencodings.h>
+#include <consensus/merkle.h>
+#include <consensus/validation.h>
+#include <primitives/block.h>
+#include <primitives/transaction.h>
+#include <test/fuzz/FuzzedDataProvider.h>
+#include <test/fuzz/fuzz.h>
+#include <test/fuzz/util.h>
+#include <test/fuzz/util/mempool.h>
+#include <test/util/setup_common.h>
+#include <test/util/txmempool.h>
+#include <txmempool.h>
+
+#include <cstddef>
+#include <cstdint>
+#include <limits>
+#include <memory>
+#include <optional>
+#include <set>
+#include <vector>
+
+namespace {
+const TestingSetup* g_setup;
+} // namespace
+
+void initialize_pdb()
+{
+    static const auto testing_setup = MakeNoLogFileContext<const TestingSetup>();
+    g_setup = testing_setup.get();
+}
+
+PartiallyDownloadedBlock::CheckBlockFn FuzzedCheckBlock(std::optional<BlockValidationResult> result)
+{
+    return [result](const CBlock& block, BlockValidationState& state, const Consensus::Params& params, bool check_pow, bool check_merkle_root) {
comments.body: nit 1136999e0ce7b13e209ac3c3153ed698938b6f6e: Any reason to mention the unused names, other than `state`? Seems fragile, given that the names may go out-of-sync in the future or may have compilers warn/error on the dummy symbols.
1136999e0ce7b13e209ac3c3153ed698938b6f6e nit: Why not `if (init_status == READ_STATUS_OK) assert(...`? Seems less confusing to have less checks in one assert.
Not that it matters, but a bitvector might use less space and time
Why would `i` ever be larger or equal to `vtx.size()`? Also, why would `BlockTxCount` ever be not equal to `vtx.size`?
Using `PickValue`, like the other enums, would be using less casts
If you want to use casts, I'd recommend std::underlying_type
Yea this is not needed, i suspect I this is a remnant of an earlier version of the target.
I don't think this is worth it for now, but I might open a follow up if this turns out to significantly improve performance.

comments.body: nit: Could move to a common header file?
nit: Could make sense to include some extraneous txs that are not in the block in the extra txn or mempool?
